thread.title: Pogba and Ibrahimovic surprise Manchester United fan
thread.title_full: Pogba and Ibrahimovic surprise Manchester United fan | Daily Mail Online

author: James Dutton For Mailonline
title: Pogba and Ibrahimovic surprise Manchester United fan
text:
A young Manchester United fan was given the surprise of a lifetime when his heroes Paul Pogba and Zlatan Ibrahimovic paid him a visit.
Young Samuel, who suffers from cerebral palsy, could hardly contain his delight as the two United stars appeared in front of him at the club's Carrington training ground.
The 11-year-old attends Manchester Creative and Media Academy and still plays football despite his illness.
Paul Pogba and Zlatan Ibrahimovic surprised a young Manchester United fan
United's two stars paid a visit to young Samuel, who suffers from cerebral palsy
The young United fan was overjoyed to be surprised by two of his footballing heroes
Samuel, who plays in goal and uses his wheelchair to aid him, was offered the chance to meet his heroes by the Manchester United Foundation.
In a short video released onto YouTube, Samuel meets the star duo and poses for pictures while discussing his cerebral palsy.
He said: 'I met Zlatan! Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Pogba. It was amazing.
'Being a big United fan is very, very amazing. Showing good emotions that they can keep going no matter what. That's what I think because when they are doing it I am saying to myself, 'never, never, never give up.'
'I mean, I'm in a wheelchair and I never give up. I don't even care about having a wheelchair. Try your hardest.'
Samuel likes to play in goal and uses a wheelchair when playing with friends
Young Manchester United fan Samuel dabbed like Paul Pogba at the end of the short video
